poem:
Title: Tides of Apathy, Cries of Humanity

In government chambers where compassion is lost,
"Bloody migrants", they echo, indifferent to cost.
Small boats bobbing, humanity ignored,
A continuum of suffering in words underscored.
In the breath of whispers, the walls have ears,
A civil servant stands, unmasking years.
Through her gaze, unkindness laid bare,
In the heart of the mighty, no room for care.
